verses.plain: O that thou wert as my brother, that sucked the breasts of my mother! when I should find thee without, I would kiss thee; yea, I should not be despised.

tokens.t: O that thou
as my brother, that sucked the breasts of my mother!
I should find thee without, I would kiss thee; yea, I should not be despised.

verses.plain: I would lead thee, and bring thee into my mother’s house, who would instruct me: I would cause thee to drink of spiced wine of the juice of my pomegranate.

tokens.t: I would lead thee,
bring thee into my mother’s house,
would instruct me: I would cause thee to drink of spiced wine of the juice of my pomegranate.

verses.plain: His left hand should be under my head, and his right hand should embrace me.

tokens.t: His left hand
under my head, and his right hand should embrace me.

verses.plain: I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, until he please.

tokens.t: I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, that ye stir not up, nor awake
love, until he please.

verses.plain: Who is this that cometh up from the wilderness, leaning upon her beloved? I raised thee up under the apple tree: there thy mother brought thee forth: there she brought thee forth that bare thee.

tokens.t: Who
this that cometh up from the wilderness, leaning upon her beloved? I raised thee up under the apple tree: there thy mother brought thee forth: there she brought thee forth
bare thee.

verses.plain: ¶ Set me as a seal upon thine heart, as a seal upon thine arm: for love is strong as death; jealousy is cruel as the grave: the coals thereof are coals of fire, which hath a most vehement flame.

tokens.t: ¶ Set me as a seal upon thine heart, as a seal upon thine arm: for love
strong as death; jealousy
cruel as the grave: the coals thereof
coals of fire,
most vehement flame.

verses.plain: Many waters cannot quench love, neither can the floods drown it: if a man would give all the substance of his house for love, it would utterly be contemned.

tokens.t: Many waters cannot quench love, neither can the floods drown it: if
man would give all the substance of his house for love, it would utterly be contemned.

verses.plain: ¶ We have a little sister, and she hath no breasts: what shall we do for our sister in the day when she shall be spoken for?

tokens.t: ¶ We have a little sister, and she hath no breasts: what shall we do for our sister in the day when she shall be spoken for?

verses.plain: If she be a wall, we will build upon her a palace of silver: and if she be a door, we will inclose her with boards of cedar.

tokens.t: If she
a wall, we will build upon her a palace of silver: and if she
a door, we will inclose her with boards of cedar.

verses.plain: I am a wall, and my breasts like towers: then was I in his eyes as one that found favour.

tokens.t: I
a wall, and my breasts like towers: then was I in his eyes as one that found favour.

verses.plain: Solomon had a vineyard at Baal-hamon; he let out the vineyard unto keepers; every one for the fruit thereof was to bring a thousand pieces of silver.

tokens.t: Solomon had a vineyard at Baal-hamon; he let out the vineyard unto keepers; every one for the fruit thereof was to bring a thousand
of silver.

verses.plain: My vineyard, which is mine, is before me: thou, O Solomon, must have a thousand, and those that keep the fruit thereof two hundred.

tokens.t: My vineyard, which
mine,
before me: thou, O Solomon,
a thousand, and those that keep the fruit thereof two hundred.

verses.plain: Thou that dwellest in the gardens, the companions hearken to thy voice: cause me to hear it.

tokens.t: Thou that dwellest in the gardens, the companions hearken to thy voice: cause me to hear

verses.plain: ¶ Make haste, my beloved, and be thou like to a roe or to a young hart upon the mountains of spices.

tokens.t: ¶ Make haste, my beloved, and be thou like to a roe or to a young hart upon the mountains of spices.

footnotes.text: I should not…: Heb. they should not despise me
that…: Heb. why should ye stir up, or, why, etc
